nonprofits.NAME: MELROSE MASSACHUSETTS TELEVISION
nonprofits.ACTIVITY: Described in section 170(b)1)(a)(vi) of the Code; Radio or television broadcasting

data.name: MELROSE MASSACHUSETTS TELEVISION
data.about: We are an international confederation of 17 like-minded charitable organizations working together to bring about lasting solutions to poverty and injustice. We work with partners around the world to make a difference in the lives of people in need.

nonprofit.name: MELROSE MASSACHUSETTS TELEVISION
nonprofit.ACTIVITY: Described in section 170(b)1)(a)(vi) of the Code; Radio or television broadcasting

giving_levels.description: For every 10 dollars spent, I will run a mile!
Donate $50 and your name will go on the back of my race shirt as a sponsor!
If you donate $100, your name will go on the back of my shirt as a sponsor and you'll get a t-shirt!

hero.headline:
Raise money
while doing
good!
hero.tagline: Want to make a far greater impact with your time?

section2.headline: The old way is OK
section2.tagline: If you do one of these and invite people to support you:

results.headline: You raise some money
results.tagline: The average walkathon, bikeathon and charity run raises $600 for charity.

section3.headline: The new way quadruples the benefits
section3.tagline: If you do a Volunteerathon™ and invite people to support you:

results.headline: You raise more money
results.tagline: People will donate larger amounts to your fundraiser if you spend your time serving others than if you walk, run or bike.

results.headline: More of it goes to charity
results.tagline: About 15% of proceeds of bikeathons etc. go to event admin and credit card costs. In a Volunteerathon™, only 4% goes to those. The extra 11% goes to charity.

results.headline: You save a nonprofit lots of money
results.tagline: If you volunteer 100 hours instead of training to ride or run long-distance, you save a nonprofit $1,200 to $1,800. That triples or quadruples your impact.

results.headline: You'll be happier
results.tagline: You’ll be more satisifed serving others than walking or running, and you’ll be happier from creating a bigger impact.

results.headline: Your friends will be happier
results.tagline: People are happier about donating their money when your time is spent volunteering than when your time is spent walking or biking.

section3.bottomline: That’s five wins instead of one for the same amount of effort

boxes.tagline: The average Volunteerathon™ raises $700, which is higher than the $600 the average walkathon/bikeathon raises. This is because people on average will donate more if your time is helping a nonprofit than if you're exercising.

If you volunteer 60 hours, you save a nonprofit about $700. If you spend another hour emailing invites and raise the $700 average, you'll double your impact in only 1/60th of the time. Would you rather contribute $700 in 60 hours or $1,400 in 61 hours?

A Volunteerathon™ also raises awareness about your cause. Some of the people you invite will be more likely to donate to or volunteer for that cause in the future. So the impact of doing a Volunteerathon™ over normal volunteering is more than double.

100 million people volunteer each year. They’re putting in the same effort as a walkathon, but they’re not generating any donations from it. If even 10% make their next volunteering be a “Volunteerathon™” and invite their friends to be sponsors and raise $700, that is $7 billion in donations per year.

nonprofit.intro: In social fundraisers like bikeathons, you spend about 100 hours training to ride or walk long-distances, and raise about $600. In a volunteerathon, you raise the same, yet use the 100 hours to volunteer, saving a nonprofit $1,200 in expenses. This means you generate $1,800: triple the impact of a normal fundraiser. Your sponsors will be happier, the nonprofits will be happier, the people being helped will be happier, and you’ll be happier. It’s a win-win-win-win of happiness.

campaign.campaign_header: A nonprofit fundraiser to raise money for:

links.name: How NOT to start a movement
Running a charity for the win
